RFID reader doesn't work with Arduino Mega 2560.
issue.body: When a standard kegboard with design date of 8/8/2011 is connected to a Arduino Mega 2560, the RFID reader is non-functional.  When connected to the serial monitor, the led will flash when a kegbot store RFID tag is brought up close, but no data is seen on the monitor.  The buzzer doesn't acknowledge either.

issue.title: Serial number keeps changing
issue.body:
We built a Kegboard shield and have it attached to a Sparkfun Redboard (https://www.sparkfun.com/products/11575; docs state it's essentially an Arduinio Uno). We found that the serial number reported by the board to the Android app changes periodically (seemingly when the app's main activity is activated). It seems that every few times the main activity is started, the "select controller" dialog pops up, and the controller has a different serial number. This is pretty annoying since we then have to reassociate the taps with the correct flow meters, and delete the old controller from the server.

Has anyone else seen this happen?

I'm happy to pull a bug report or other diagnostic data, if needed.

issue.title: KBPM hang
issue.body:
From @hanzov69 on Kegbot/kegbot-android#85:

> Not sure if this actually belong to kegbot-android, but periodically my KBPM board will "hang". LED for flow activity remains lit, Android app shows connected controller, however flow is not registered.
> 
> Removing power from KBPM and re-connecting generally corrects this.

issue.title: Arduino Leo, build errors + flow LEDS remain on
issue.body:
Good day -

I've completed most of the build, but when getting to the point of compiling and flashing the firmware for the Arduino, I received the following errors:

```
buzzer.cpp: In function 'void setupBuzzer()':
buzzer.cpp:54: error: 'TCCR2A' was not declared in this scope
buzzer.cpp: In function 'void playMidiNote(uint8_t, uint8_t)':
buzzer.cpp:60: error: 'TCCR2B' was not declared in this scope
buzzer.cpp:65: error: 'OCR2A' was not declared in this scope
```

After reviewing the kegbot.org forum I found that this is due to timer differences in Ardiuno Leo, and followed the advice here: https://kegbot.org/kegbb/index.php?p=/discussion/682

This allowed me to get the firmware on the device, but now the Flow LEDs remain on from power-up, and the tester scripts return nothing.

Any advise or fix you can provide to allow the firmware to work correctly on Arduino Leo?

Thanks!

issue.title: added parallax.h and parall.cpp files
issue.body:
Mike, I found these files on github, and I figure you should add them to the kegbot project, so that way people with the $10 radio shack rfid reader have support for using their RFID reader, let me know if there are any problems, as this is my first pull request on github.

cheers
-Chris
